front.title: DNS Request and Transaction Signatures ( SIG(0)s )

abstract.t: Extensions to the Domain Name System (DNS) can provide data originand transaction integrity and authentication to security awareresolvers and applications through the use of cryptographic digitalsignatures. However, these security extensions do not provideauthentication at the transaction or message level. This documentdescribes a message authentication scheme (called SIG(0)) thatprovides message level authentication and integrity checking by meansof a meta-RR in the additional section of a DNS message.
